The index of the item to remove

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableExtensions.Sorted``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``0})
Sorted
member.summary: Returns the sorted version of `lst` using either the default comparer, or the comparer passed as an argument
member.param: The List to sort
IComparer object for the sort algorithm to use
member.returns: The sorted version of `lst`

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableExtensions.IsPermutation(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
IsPermutation
member.summary: Tests if `lst` represents a mathematical permutation of the integers from 0 to `lst.Count-1`
member.param: The List of integers to test
member.example: {1, 2, 0, 4, 3} is a permutation, but {2,3,1} and {1,2,4} are not
member.returns: The boolean result of the test

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableExtensions.Permute``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
Permute
member.code: List Permute(this List lst, List lut)
member.summary: Applies the permutation represented by `lut` to `lst`
member.typeparam: The type of the List to permute
member.param: The List to permute
The lookup table to use for the permutation
member.returns: The permuted version of the list
member.remarks: If `lut.IsPermutation!=true || lut.Count != lst.Count`, a FormatException will be thrown

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableExtensions.FlipPermutation(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
FlipPermutation
member.summary: Flips the permutation represented by `lut` (which corresponds to doing `lut.Permute(lut)`
member.param: The List object representing the permutation
member.returns: The flipped version of `lut`
member.remarks: If `lut.IsPermutation == false`, a FormatException will be thrown

member.name: M:System.Linq.EnumerableExtensions.CompareTo(System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
CompareTo
member.summary: Compares to int[] value by value
member.param: This instance
The other int[] to compare `this` to
member.returns: An integer indicating the relative values of `a` and `b`: -1 if ais less than b, 1 if a is greater than b, 0 if a is equal to b

member.name: T:System.Linq.StringExtensions
StringExtensions
member.summary: A collection of extension methods for string objects

member.name: M:System.Linq.StringExtensions.FindNumbers(System.String)
FindNumbers
member.summary: Searches all the numrical values in `str`
member.param: The string to search in
member.returns: An int[] containing all the values

member.name: M:System.Linq.StringExtensions.ToIntEnumerable(System.String)
ToIntEnumerable
member.summary: Converts the string to a set of integers by converting each char to its numerical value and evaluating any potential number
member.param: The string to iterate through
member.returns: An IEnumerable object generating the values
member.remarks: This method is internal and shouldn't be used directly. It is only there to be used by the CompareNumerically method

member.name: M:System.Linq.StringExtensions.CompareNumerically(System.String,System.String)
CompareNumerically
member.summary: Compares strings which might contain numbers and returns an indication of their relative values
member.param: This instance
The string to compare to
member.returns: A signed integer indicating the relative values of `this` and `other`: -1 if `this` is smaller than `other`, 1 if `this` is greater than `other`, 0 if they're equal

member.summary: Creates a copy of `obj`
member.param: The object to be copied
member.returns: A `T` object copy of `obj`
member.remarks: The `T` class has to be marked as [Serializable] for this function to work

The list to return if the user hits Enter
